availabilityZone.description: The Availability Zone where you want to create your instances. Use the following formatting: us-east-1a (case sensitive).

bundleId.description: The bundle of specification information for your virtual private server (or instance), including the pricing plan (e.g., micro_1_0).

instanceNames.description: The names for your new instances.

instanceSnapshotName.description: The name of the instance snapshot on which you are basing your new instances. Use the get instance snapshots operation to return information about your existing snapshots.

keyPairName.description: The name for your key pair.

userData.description: You can create a launch script that configures a server with additional user data. For example, apt-get –y update.  Depending on the machine image you choose, the command to get software on your instance varies. Amazon Linux and CentOS use yum, Debian and Ubuntu use apt-get, and FreeBSD uses pkg. For a complete list, see the Dev Guide.
